metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The <schema> element is the root element of every XML Schema.
content.html: The <schema> element is the root element of every XML Schema.

content.text: The <schema> element is the root element of every XML Schema:
content.html: The <schema> element is the root element of every XML Schema:

content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0"?>

<xs:schema>
...
...
</xs:schema>

content.text: The <schema> element may contain some attributes. A schema declaration often looks something like this:
content.html: The <schema> element may contain some attributes. A schema declaration often looks something like this:

content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0"?>

<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
targetNamespace="https://www.w3schools.com"
xmlns="https://www.w3schools.com"
elementFormDefault="qualified">
...
...
</xs:schema>
xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"

content.text: indicates that the elements and data types used in the schema come from the "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" namespace. It also specifies that the elements and data types that come from the "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" namespace should be prefixed with xs:
content.html: indicates that the elements and data types used in the schema come from the "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" namespace. It also specifies that the elements and data types that come from the "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" namespace should be prefixed with xs:

content.code_html: targetNamespace="https://www.w3schools.com"

content.text: indicates that the elements defined by this schema (note, to, from, heading, body.) come from the "https://www.w3schools.com" namespace.
content.html: indicates that the elements defined by this schema (note, to, from, heading, body.) come from the "https://www.w3schools.com" namespace.

content.code_html: xmlns="https://www.w3schools.com"

content.text: indicates that the default namespace is "https://www.w3schools.com".

content.code_html: elementFormDefault="qualified"

content.text: indicates that any elements used by the XML instance document which were declared in this schema must be namespace qualified.
content.html: indicates that any elements used by the XML instance document which were declared in this schema must be namespace qualified.

content.text: Referencing a Schema in an XML Document
This XML document has a reference to an XML Schema:
content.html: This XML document has a reference to an XML Schema:

content.code:
<?xml version="1.0"?>


<note xmlns="https://www.w3schools.com"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:schemaLocation="https://www.w3schools.com note.xsd">


<to>Tove</to>

<from>Jani</from>

<heading>Reminder</heading>

<body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>

</note>
content.code_html:
<?xml version="1.0"?>

<note xmlns="https://www.w3schools.com"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:schemaLocation="https://www.w3schools.com note.xsd">

<to>Tove</to>
<from>Jani</from>
<heading>Reminder</heading>
<body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body>
</note>
xmlns="https://www.w3schools.com"

content.text: specifies the default namespace declaration. This declaration tells the schema-validator that all the elements used in this XML document are declared in the "https://www.w3schools.com" namespace.
content.html: specifies the default namespace declaration. This declaration tells the schema-validator that all the elements used in this XML document are declared in the "https://www.w3schools.com" namespace.

content.text: Once you have the XML Schema Instance namespace available:
content.html: Once you have the XML Schema Instance namespace available:

content.code_html: xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"

content.text: you can use the schemaLocation attribute. This attribute has two values, separated by a space. The first value is the namespace to use. The second value is the location of the XML schema to use for that namespace:
content.html: you can use the schemaLocation attribute. This attribute has two values, separated by a space. The first value is the namespace to use. The second value is the location of the XML schema to use for that namespace:

content.code_html: xsi:schemaLocation="https://www.w3schools.com note.xsd"
